intro: Psychotria brachypus, commonly known as the short-stemmed Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with high humidity and warm climates. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. Psychotria brachypus is often found in moist lowland forests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
